content: I'm excited to start reading "The Golden Compass". I've heard that the book has a slow burn at the beginning, but it picks up pace as the story unfolds. I'm looking forward to immersing myself in the world of Cittàgazze and Lyra's adventures. Can you tell me a bit more about the pacing and tone of the book? Is it more focused on action and adventure, or does it delve deeper into the characters' thoughts and emotions?
